title: Krautburger Recipe
description: A lean version of a German beef and cabbage filled roll. They freeze very well, and are good dipped in mustard.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Krautburger 4.4 (77) 55 Reviews 10 Photos A lean version of a German beef and cabbage filled roll. They freeze very well, and are good dipped in mustard. Submitted by Marlene Updated on November 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 40 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 16 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings 1 pound lean ground beef 1 onion, chopped ½ medium head cabbage, shredded ½ (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix 1 (8 ounce) package mild Cheddar cheese, sliced black pepper to taste 2 (1 pound) loaves frozen bread dough, thawed butter flavored cooking spray ¼ cup margarine, melted Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place ground beef in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain fat. Stir in cabbage and onion soup mix; cook 5 minutes longer, or until lightly browned. Set aside. Roll one loaf of bread dough into a 16x8 inch rectangle, then cut into eight 4 inch squares. Spoon cabbage mixture into center of each square, top with 1 small slice cheese and bring up diagonal points, pinching edges closed. Place krautburgers on a cookie sheet coated with cooking spray, and let rise for about 10 minutes. Bake for 20 minutes, or until brown. Brush tops of warm rolls with margarine. Repeat process with second loaf of bread and remaining cabbage mixture and cheese. I Made It Print 81 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 307 Calories 13g Fat 30g Carbs 15g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 16 Calories 307 % Daily Value * Total Fat 13g 17% Saturated Fat 5g 24% Cholesterol 33mg 11% Sodium 537mg 23% Total Carbohydrate 30g 11% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 4g Protein 15g 30% Vitamin C 11mg 12% Calcium 119mg 9% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 140mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Krautburger 01 of 10 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 10 Photo by  MamaMia57 01/31/2021 03 of 10 Photo by  jan 01/22/2019 I used frozen roll mix. I omitted the French onion soup added thyme instead and used mozzarella cheese instead of cheddar ! They were wonderful! 04 of 10 Photo by  Todd Simpson 11/14/2018 05 of 10 Photo by  Latoya Newton 10/20/2014 This was pretty good, the meat mixture was really good. I used frozen dinner rolls because I could not find frozen bread dough in the store, I used two rolls for each sandwich. 06 of 10 Photo by  pinkie Learns to Cook 04/05/2014 07 of 10 Photo by  Angela Thorassie 01/12/2012 I've made these twice, first time with my husband who ate 4 of them because he liked them so much! The second time was for guests who also very much enjoyed them. Definitely going to be doing these over and over. 08 of 10 Photo by  chandra 01/21/2011 09 of 10 Photo by  Virgil 08/28/2007 I don't use the onion soup mix, but use a couple of pinches of red pepper flakes, brush the tops with butter when just out of the oven and sprinkle with sesseme seeds....Das esse guttes zum essen!. 1 You’ll Also Love Cabbage Rolls 187 Ratings Grandma Elaine's Unstuffed Cabbage Rolls 93 Ratings Easy Cabbage Pockets 5 Ratings Polish Gołąbki (Stuffed Cabbage Rolls) 15 Ratings Golabki (Stuffed Cabbage Rolls) 43 Ratings Turkey Cabbage Rolls 144 Ratings Ground Beef and Cabbage Casserole 4 Ratings Runza Burritos International 46 Ratings Jan's Beer-Brined Corned Beef 4 Ratings Cheddar Bratzenkraut 2 Ratings Sausage and Sauerkraut 291 Ratings German Pork Chops and Sauerkraut 239 Ratings Zoodle Lasagne 41 Ratings Bierrocks I 28 Ratings Chicken Spectacular 126 Ratings Sour Cream Burgers 252 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Marlene
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place ground beef in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain fat. Stir in cabbage and onion soup mix; cook 5 minutes longer, or until lightly browned. Set aside.;Roll one loaf of bread dough into a 16x8 inch rectangle, then cut into eight 4 inch squares. Spoon cabbage mixture into center of each square, top with 1 small slice cheese and bring up diagonal points, pinching edges closed. Place krautburgers on a cookie sheet coated with cooking spray, and let rise for about 10 minutes.;Bake for 20 minutes, or until brown. Brush tops of warm rolls with margarine. Repeat process with second loaf of bread and remaining cabbage mixture and cheese.
